info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 19 at 6:09PM CDT until April 19 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Western Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Culberson County in southwestern Texas...
* Until 730 PM CDT/630 PM MDT/.
* At 607 PM CDT/507 PM MDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Whites City to 21 miles north of Plateau to near Van Horn, moving southeast at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Near zero visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite imagery.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 208. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 25.
Locations impacted include... McKittrick Canyon, Star Mountain, Balmorhea, Otis, Loving, McDonald Observatory, Lobo, Pine Springs, Toyahvale, Buffalo Trail Scout Camp, Valentine, Van Horn, Orla, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Bloys Camp, Plateau, Black Mountain, Kent, Queen, and Cavern City Air Terminal.
info.instruction:
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 7:30 PM CDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 7:30 PM CDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Eddy, NM; Culberson, TX; Jeff Davis, TX; Reeves, TX

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:30 PM CDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:30 PM CDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Eddy, NM; Culberson, TX; Jeff Davis, TX; Reeves, TX
